position.marginalia_text: Romana[e] Virtutis singulare Exemplum, Ca[e]saris Militia:

marginalia.translation: The warfare of Caesar is the single example of Roman virtue: it is necessary to add it to this Art of War, along with the Stratagems of Frontinus and Polyaenus. This very exercise, and military practice, will most easily complete all other military documents, actively adapted to the living instructions a and powerful examples of today's experience.

position.marginalia_text: { Owr Inglish militar Discipline, Under General Norris, jn [the] Dialogus, intitu[l]id, The Castle of Pollicy: Under [the] Earle of Leicester, In his owne Lawes, & Ordinances. The Spanish Discipline, under [the] Duke d'Alva, & [the] Prince of Parma, [the] best Discipline now in Esse, newly discoursid by Sir Roger Williams.

book.title: The castle, or picture of policy

position.marginalia_text: Virtus, et Fortuna humana, multis Experimentis coiuncta; in Bello Potens. Olaus Magnus. Ca[e]sar omnem Foelicitatem, Fortunamq[ue] ipsam tribuit, duabus potentissimis Artibus, Scientia[e], et Virtuti: quarum omnis Laus in Actione. Parùm sepulta[e] distat Inertia[e], Celata Virtus.

marginalia.translation: Virtue, and human fortune, are connected in many experiences, powerful in war. Olaus Magnus. Caesar assigned every felicity and fortune of himself to the two most powerful skills: knowledge, and virtue: all glory in action [comes] of these. Hidden virtue differs too little from burried ignorance.

position.marginalia_text: Mie principal Autors for Warr, after much reading, & long consideration: Ca[e]sar, & Vegetius: Machiauel, & Gandino: Ranzouius, & Tetti: with owr Sutcliff, Sir Roger Williams, & Digges Stratioticos: all sharp, & sound masters of Warr. For [the] Art, Vegetius, Machiauel, & Sutcliff: for Stratagems, Gandino, & Ranzouius: for Fortification, Pyrotechnic, & engins, Tetti, & Digges: for [the] old Roman most Worthie Discipline & Action, Ca[e]sar: for [the] now Spanish, & Inglish excellent Discipline & Action, Sir Ro[ger] Williams. Autors enowgh; with [the] most cunning, & Ualorous practis in Esse.

underline.text: moste shorte time, to haue shewed
